My name is Levi and I’m representing the StarkNet Vietnam Community. For the past 6 months, we have been actively involved in the StarkNet ecosystem. During this time, we have successfully built a close-knit community in Vietnam and have contributed to the growth and development of the network through various activities such as participating in community forums and discussions, writing articles or blog posts about StarkNet, and organizing meetups or events. We are now seeking to become a delegate of the StarkNet Governance.


Why do you want to be a delegate? How do you plan to fulfill this role?

We are interested in joining the StarkNet governance team because we support the goals of building a decentralized, sustainable ecosystem that benefits all stakeholders. As a member of the governance team, we hope to contribute to the growth and development of the network through active participation in discussions and decision-making, promoting transparency and accountability, and educating the Vietnamese community about StarkNet and its values. We also want to help create a supportive, informed community where there is no room for unethical behavior such as seedings, shillings, and where we are not just a group of investors and degens, but also a community of builders and developers. To that end, we plan to work with universities in the area to encourage developers from other languages to adopt Cairo, and with the support of the StarkWare team, we hope to incubate and educate developers so that they can build real products on StarkNet and contribute to the ecosystem.


Please list and explain the core values that will guide your decision-making

  • Decentralization: We believe in the power of decentralization to create a more fair and equitable society, and will prioritize decisions that support the decentralization of the StarkNet ecosystem.
  • Transparency: We believe that transparency is essential for building trust and accountability within the community, and will prioritize decisions that promote transparency in governance and decision-making.
  • Sustainability: We believe that the long-term success of StarkNet depends on its ability to be financially and environmentally sustainable, and will prioritize decisions that support the sustainability of the network.
  • Security: We believe that the security of the StarkNet network is of the utmost importance, and will prioritize decisions that enhance the security of the network.
  • Education: We believe that education is crucial for the growth and development of the StarkNet ecosystem, and will prioritize decisions that support education and knowledge-sharing within the community.


Why should someone delegate to you? Anything token-holders should know about you?

As passionate and committed members of the StarkNet community, we believe that our skills and expertise makes us a strong candidate for delegation. We have a proven track record of contributions to the ecosystem and a deep understanding of the principles and values that guide the network. We are willing to take on the responsibilities of a delegate and are committed to fostering transparency, accountability, and engagement with the community. We are also open to diverse perspectives and are dedicated to educating and sharing knowledge with fellow users in the Vietnamese community. In our decision-making, we will prioritize these values and work towards the growth and development of the StarkNet network.


Please provide your skills and areas of expertise

As a team, we have diverse areas of expertise, with a focus on DeFi, NFTs, and cryptocurrency. We are dedicated to staying current in these rapidly evolving industries by learning about new trends and technologies, and participating in educational programs and events. Additionally, we have a strong background in creating and curating digital content, including writing blog posts, creating social media posts, designing infographics, and producing video content. Our extensive networks in Vietnam and our organizational skills also enable us to effectively communicate complex information in an engaging and understandable way. These strengths make me, as a voice of the StarkNet Vietnam community, well-suited to serve as a delegate in StarkNet Governance.


Please provide any potential conflicts of interest with your participation in StarkNet governance as a delegate.

At the moment, I do not have any conflicts of interest that I am aware of, but I will make sure to disclose any that arise during the delegation process. It is important to be transparent and upfront about any potential conflicts of interest, as they can have a significant impact on the outcome of the work being delegated.

Hi everyone. I’m Nathan, the ecosystem lead at Snapshot Labs. With this candidacy, I aim to represent both myself and Snapshot, so I’ll introduce both.

I’m a political philosophy researcher with a strong interest in blockchains and the governance of decentralized networks. I worked previously around the topic of limiting the influence of Big Tech on the internet and that research brought me here, as I believe that the early stage of governance on decentralized networks is crucial to turning the centralization of power in the digital space. I’ve been working at Snapshot as the ecosystem lead to try to guide the organization toward that vision. I’ve quickly taken interest in StarkNet, as we announced our cooperation on Snapshot X, a fully on-chain voting framework, and have since then organized two meetups in Brussels attended by dozens of enthusiasts as well as companies like Argent, Ledger, StarkWare, or the chads at Briq.


Values

Snapshot itself is the home of governance for a vast majority of DAOs. Around summer 2021, we decided to make the same bet as many of you here, that ZK Rollups were the future of blockchain, and that StarkWare had the best shot to deliver on that vision. Since then, our team has been very active in the StarkNet ecosystem creating key infrastructure pieces including Checkpoint, contributions to storage proofs, native Ethereum signatures, and contributions on Pathfinder.

Our vision for Snapshot X is an unstoppable set of governance smart contracts that any DAO, community or even political entity can use for free in order to create a basis for fair governance. For that reason, we need StarkNet to be as decentralized and secure as possible. As a delegate, this will be the core value I’ll be representing.

We have strong experience in DAO governance, not simply by being the platform where most of it happens. We’ve been active delegates in the ENS DAO, the Safe DAO, and the Optimism token house. In all of these, we’ve promoted the values of ecosystem growth, fairness, and progressive decentralization.


Conflicts of interest

StarkNet’s governance will happen on Snapshot, and then Snapshot X. We don’t believe that this creates a conflict of interest though, as we are even more strongly incentivized to see it succeed. It however could cause us to promote Snapshot over other governance frameworks.

Please provide your past experience and contributions to the StarkNet ecosystem.

StableLab has shown our support for the StarkNet ecosystem long before we decided to apply to become a delegate. We have voted in support of MakerDAO’s collaboration with StarkNet via voting in support of almost 10 StarkNet-related votings, including Initial Parameters for StarkNet Simple DAI Bridge, Maker Teleport Deployment on Starknet and Associated Risk Parameters - August 1, and Maker Teleport Deployment on Starknet and Associated Risk Parameters - August 15

We also supported StarkNet through a recent Aave On-Chain vote titled Aave StarkNet Phase I - Aave <> StarkNet Bridge deployment/activation 1.


Why do you want to be a delegate? How do you plan to fulfill this role?

StarkNet is focused on providing permissionless decentralized scalability to dApps. We want to support the future of zk-rollups and their role in allowing dApps to scale without compromising Ethereum’s composability or security. With reliable governance, StarkNet will be able to grow safely and sustainably. We look forward to playing a key role in turning StarkNet’s vision into reality.

We focus on meaningful participation in each DAO we work in. In addition to voting, commenting, and presenting proposals, we take on active leadership roles in the communities. Through these leadership positions and the proposals we author, we can initiate positive change across the DeFi ecosystem.

Our commitment to providing value to DAO governance has allowed us to grow to be one of the largest delegates in most major DAOs and serve on important committees in others. For example, in both MakerDAO, Element Finance, and 1inch, we started with minor delegation and are now the top delegates.

One way we provide more value than the traditional delegate is by authoring proposals in the DAOs we work in. StableLab recently authored successful proposals in 1inch, Hop, Element Finance 1, and Jet. We are able to identify the needs of the DAO, draft professional and well-thought-out proposals, and use community feedback to enact positive change. This allows us to present new ideas and help the DAOs progress toward their goals, one proposal at a time.


Please list and explain the core values that will guide your decision-making.

Active: We participate in every aspect of the governance process, ranging from presenting proposals, providing feedback in the forums, and active voting.


Research: Our decisions are backed by scientific research.


Trust: We act unbiased and transparent, according to our code of conduct, driven by a strong set of ethics and values.


Please provide your past experience in DAO governance.

StableLab currently acts as a delegate for Maker, Aave, Balancer, Optimism, Jet, Element Finance, Safe, 1inch, Hop, Paladin, and Euler. We have a team of governance analysts 1 that works together to ensure we are active and informed delegates in all the DAOs we work with.


Additionally, StableLab currently holds/held the following special roles:


  • MakerDAO: 2nd Recognized Delegate
  • Optimism DeFi Committee A: Committee member (Season 2 has now finished)
  • Element Finance: Operations Lead & 2nd GSC member
  • Compound Grants Committee: Domain allocator

Our voting history can be seen here on boardroom 1 or on our notion tracker.


Please provide your skills and areas of expertise.


  • Governance
  • DeFi
  • DAOs
  • Operations


Why should someone delegate to you? Anything token-holders should know about you?

StableLab is a “professional delegate” working on decentralized governance across various DeFi protocols. To ensure that StableLab is represented in a uniform and value-driven manner, we have a set of governance delegate policies 2 that team members follow. Our goal is to participate in a professional, unbiased, transparent, and reliable manner while promoting the journey to full decentralization. Our expertise is the product of our research and years of experience working with and for DAOs.

Our team has been in the space for many years, both in research and as core contributors to protocols such as MakerDAO. We are focused on supporting protocols to reach a safe and sustainable level of decentralization.

There is no one-size-fits-all approach but we provide a framework of principles and tools we have developed throughout our experience. We have developed a systematic and robust approach to governance and growth. Creating principles that optimize the objective outcome of the decision-making process is key to successful governance.


Please provide any potential conflicts of interest with your participation in StarkNet governance as a delegate.

StableNode invested in various entities such as Forta and Superfluid. StableNode contributes to various protocols’ governance, such as MakerDAO, Element Finance, Balancer, 1inch, and others, all disclosed on our website.

StableNode will disclose in case the voting might create conflicts of interest. StableLab works as the governance arm of StableNode.


What we like about Starknet

Stable Node envisions Starknet becoming one of the leading layer 2s on Ethereum. Using STARKs, as well as the native innovations, StarkNet will allow dApps to achieve unlimited scale at a fraction of the cost.

StarkNets native account abstraction will enable a more seamless experience within crypto ranging from social recovery, session keys, and batch operations, amongst others, for interacting with DeFi, Games, and Web3. This will introduce a much-needed improved UX and contribute to onboarding the next millions of users.


How do we work?

  • At Stable Node, we have a team of governance analysts constantly researching and participating in the DeFi space.
  • This allows us to keep our skills and knowledge up to date so we can make informed decisions. Additionally, our team is able to use the knowledge to brainstorm new experimental ideas and innovations regarding governance, keeping our team to be on the leading edge of governance.
  • Finally, we make it a point to build relationships with the community and core team for each protocol we work in to ensure we are meeting the needs of each protocol. We hope to use our research, new ideas, and personal connections to help StarkNet achieve its goals.

Hi everyone, I’m Park, a dedicated community member and active builder in the Starknet ecosystem. Over the past year, and together with @doreami93, I have been working on several core ecosystem projects including Sphinx (a composable on-chain order book - 1st place @ StarkNet Autumn Hackathon), Switch (a trustless wallet recovery service - 1st place @ StarkNet House Hackathon) and scaffold-stark (2nd place @ ethCC Paris Hack).

As builders on Starknet, we are in constant communication with the StarkWare team and frequently monitor protocol updates. We are excited about this opportunity to participate in its governance.


Why me?

I have substantial experience in DAO governance through running the LBS Blockchain delegate platform at MakerDAO and Aave. LBS Blockchain is one of the leading and fastest growing student run blockchain / web3 organisations comprising of students from London Business School. We are a community of 750+ students and alumni in our community Telegram and recently hosted the second iteration of London Blockchain Summit, inviting over 40 speakers and hosting 200+ attendees from around the world.

Our governance team liaises with ecosystem partners like Llama, Chaos Labs and Gauntlet to review and debate new proposals before submitting a memo for internal review and final on-chain voting. We have a rigorous process and prioritise defensability and transparency in our decision-making. We have also launched proposal alerts services for MakerDAO and Aave to assist delegates with monitoring new proposals, and would be happy to set up something similar for Starknet Governance.


Core Values

My core values as a delegate are:

  1. Independence: although LBS Blockchain receives substantial delegated stakes from a16z and the Aave Foundation, we have always maintained our independence and voted in line with the best interest of the community. Where necessary, we have voted against the majority before, and will continue to resist external influence by basing our decisions on sound reason.
  2. Transparency: I commit to publishing my opinions and voting rationale to this forum to ensure transparency in decision-making, and to hold myself accountable to external scrutiny. I strive to engage with community members and delegates and will revise my own views and process where appropriate, based on external feedback.
  3. Collaboration: I believe the Starknet ecosystem is special because of its community. I will seek to invite diverse ideas and opinions to ensure all voices are heard, and create an inclusive space for the Starknet and wider web3 community.


Conflicts of Interest

As mentioned above, I currently take part in the governance of other DeFi projects, but expect to hand over that role later in the year.

Feel free to DM me directly on this platform or reach out via Telegram @parkyeuth or @doreami93 if you have any questions regarding our delegate platform.

Introduction

Hello there !


I am Bouchut, a French blockchain engineer and have been in the crypto-space since the end of 2017.


I started with Bitcoin mining in my student’s room, then I mined on other chains, ran masternodes, experimented with DeFi when it skyrocketed, traded NFTs, developed smart contracts and wrote a few articles on these subjects. As a software engineer, I’m approaching all these topics from a technical point of view and by digging every day deeper to see how protocols actually work.


Concerning Starknet, I was already convinced at the end of 2021 of the interest and the imminent expansion of layer 2s. I then followed the topic during 2022 while participating in the testnets and the experiments of several projects (nodes, wallets, dApp, bridges). Moreover, I explored the different types of layer 2s that are actively being developed (Optimistic Rollups, Zk Rollups, Zk EVM).

I am convinced that layer 2s are the future of programmable blockchain’s scalability. I am also convinced of a near future where different layer 2s would coexist (dedicated layers for application like Sorare or Immutable X, privacy focused or zk EVM ones, etc.).

As a developer, I have already started to dig into the technical functioning of Starknet and developed some projects in Cairo. I have for example done a lot of research on Account Abstraction (which is natively allowed by Starknet) and developed a multisig with improved governance rules. You can access the code and an article written on the subject here: Starknet multisig article 2

Besides, I am a member of the Starknet community since the beginning. I attended all the French meetups of the year as well as the first edition of StarknetCC in Paris.


My view on the Starknet governance

Today, as you all know, the decentralization of all layer 2s is really minimal. At the moment, only a few entities take care of the core infrastructure elements that constitute the rollups (sequencer, prover, verifier, fraud proof, zk-proof, bridge), the code is not open source and the evolution of the protocols is decided by the teams behind it. Starknet is not an exception to the rule and I hope that thanks to this governance system, we will be able to make the right decisions to improve the security of the network, its resilience and thus make the chain evolve in the right direction to attract even more capital that, for the moment, remains on Ethereum for security reasons.]


Skills and area of expertise

Concerning my skillset, I’m mainly a blockchain developer specialized in smart contracts development (Solidity, Cairo) with some frontend (React, Typescript, Tailwind) to add a nice GUI to my projects, but I also run blockchain nodes (Ethereum, Starknet) and explore other technical elements (Account Abstraction, private key security, NFT’s metadata management, running a Chainlink node recently). I also love doing on-chain analysis.


Potential conflicts of interest

I work in the Crypto Advisory team of a Big Four firm where the main values are integrity and being impartial in all our decisions. So I have no conflicts of interest as a future delegate.


Requests of Delegators

If you have any requests, I would be happy to discuss them. Let’s make the best decisions for Starknet !

BlockLand DAO is a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) that aims to bring together a community of individuals who are passionate about blockchain and crypto industry in Turkey. Led by Tobby Kitty, we have been active for more than 2 years, with a community of over 6,000 engaged members. Our goal is to help each other, participate in various events, and become proficient in blockchain and cryptocurrency in Turkey.


Overview

BlockLand DAO is one of the most active and high-quality DAOs in Turkey. Our community is made up of individuals from all walks of life, who are united in their passion for blockchain and cryptocurrency. We have a strong focus on education and community building, and we are constantly seeking new ways to improve our understanding of blockchain and cryptocurrency. We are proud to have a diverse group of community members, including developers, investors, and enthusiasts, who come together to share their knowledge and experience. Additionally, teams from projects such as Fibrous Finance, mosoGallery, and StarkRock have emerged from our DAO.


Our Motivation to Become a Delegate for StarkNet

We believe that StarkNet has great potential Validity Rollup, and we want to become a part of its ecosystem. As a delegate, we can represent the voice of our community and make informed decisions on its behalf. We are excited about the opportunity to contribute to the development and success of StarkNet, and we believe that our community has the skills and expertise to make a positive impact. Additionally, we anticipate that BlockLand DAO will also be a cadidate for future decentralization of StarkNet as a block proposer.


Core Values

Decentralization is at the heart of our organization. We believe in the power of the community to make informed decisions and we will always act in the best interests of the StarkNet ecosystem. Additionally, we will provide research reports and spark useful discussions within our community to ensure that voting is as accurate and sound as possible. Our community members are encouraged to participate in discussions, ask questions, and share their thoughts and ideas to help make the best decisions for the future of StarkNet.


Requests for Delegators

We welcome any requests or questions from delegators. Please feel free to reach out to us through DM or Discord, and we will respond as soon as possible. We are committed to transparency and open communication with our delegators, and we will keep them informed of any developments or updates related to our delegation.


Conflicts of Interest

BlockLand DAO has no conflicts of interest. We only have partnerships with projects, which we transparently share with our community. We are committed to acting in the best interests of StarkNet and our delegators, and we will not engage in any activities that may compromise our integrity or the trust of our community.
